STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
March 25, 2019
Darnell Britt
Community Care Organization
18688 Joann
Detroit, MI 48205
RE: License #: CB820315857
Community Care Organization
18688 Joann
Detroit, MI 48205
Dear Mr. Britt:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 03/06/2019.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and
Implementation, Sustainability, and Exit Plan (ISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the ISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from
the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 Be signed and dated.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3012
Enclosure
Kendra Washington, LD
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12212 Personnel records.
(3) The personnel record shall contain both of the
following:
(d) Three references obtained from persons who are
unrelated to the staff person.
Three out of six employee records reviewed, three of the employee personal records
reviewed did not have documentation of three references. The employees only had
two references.
R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following
information and documentation, which shall be recorded
within 30 calendar days after placement in independent
living and updated at least once every 90 calendar days:
(a) All of the following personal information pertaining to
the youth:
(i) Name.
(ii) Social security number.
(iii) Address and telephone number.
(iv) Date of birth.
(v) Gender
(vi) Race.
(vii) Height.
(viii) Weight.
(ix) Hair color.
(x) Eye color.
(xi) Identifying marks.
(xii) A photograph updated on an annual basis.
One out of four independent living case records reviewed, one did not have the
youth height, weight, hair color or eye color.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
4

ISEP 4.22 MiSACWIS.
MiSACWIS
(Commitment
22)
DHHS will maintain an operational statewide automated
child welfare information system (MiSACWIS) which will be
the primary tracking system and satisfy federal reporting
requirements.
The following information was not uploaded into MiSACWIS though noted in the
paper case record, the agency is not consistent with uploading information:
 Medical passports
 USP Signature page
 IL youth intake assessment conclusion
 Updated service plans
 69b
 Family team meetings
REPEAT VIOLATION FROM RENEWAL JANUARY 2018
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
DHHS Policy Family Team Meetings
FOM 722-6B -
page 2
The following events shall trigger FTM for out of home cases:
• Case service plan development,
• permanency goal changes,
• placement preservation/disruption
• permanency planning at six months in care annual transition
planning for youth every six months from age 16 until case
closure
• 90 - day discharge planning for youth
• Case closure
Four out of four case records reviewed did not have documentation of an FTM prior
to the service plans being held. Four case records did not have an FTM for the
independent living youth uploaded into MiSACWIS.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
5

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during
this licensing period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted three acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a CAP on 01/29/2018 for the Renewal Inspection that was
completed on 01/29/2018. The CAP was approved on 01/29/2018. The agency was
in non-compliance with the following violations:
R400.12509 (3, a) (xii) Photograph update
R400.12509 (3, a) Birth certificate
R400.12516 (1, b) Independent living contract
ISEP – 4.22 MiSACWIS (Commitment 22)
The agency affectively addressed the citations noted in the renewal inspection of
2018 as there was only one repeat violation noted that the agency continues to
struggle with.
Special investigation #2018C0201040 was initiated on 06/19/2018. The report was
sent out on 10/17/2018 and a corrective action plan was received on 10/25/2018. The
agency was found in violation with DHHS Policy FOM -722-03 Placement selection
and standards: Placement exception request. The agency social service worker did
not complete the DHHS form 786 requesting an exception request explaining why the
two youth in their program did not step down to a less restrictive placement. The
agency completed an acceptable corrective action plan and the plan appears to have
been successful as no repeat citations are noted.
Special investigation #2018C0201046 was initiated on 07/24/2018. The report was
sent out on 12/12/2018 and a corrective action plan was received on 12/12/2018. The
agency was found in violation with R400.12502 Program statement. The agency
representative did not follow the agency program statement by allowing a homeless
youth who was discharge from the IL program prior and her three-month-old baby
spend an overnight in one of the independent living homes. The baby was not
responding the next morning and had to be rushed to the hospital. The agency
submitted an acceptable corrective action plan and there has been no repeat citation.
6

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that Community Care Organization
continue on a regular license.
03/25/2019
________________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
March 26, 2019
________________________________________
Linda D. Tansil Date
Area Manager
